description.value:
Rite of Summoning
Mystic Rite • Level 2

Time: 1 hour
Cost: 3 Gnosis
Requirement: A prepared ritual space and a clear spiritual focus related to the spirit being summoned

Description

The Rite of Summoning calls a spirit's attention and invites it to appear before the Garou. Through ritual, offering, and invocation, the Garou sends a formal summons into the Umbra, requesting the spirit's presence.

This Rite does not compel obedience. It asks for an audience.

Effect

When the Gnosis cost is paid, the Rite succeeds automatically.

Choose a minor or moderate spirit known to the Garou or reasonably associated with the ritual focus (such as a place, concept, object, or past interaction).

Upon completion:

  • The spirit becomes aware of the summons
  • If willing, the spirit manifests within the ritual space in the Umbra or at the nearest appropriate spiritual boundary
  • The spirit may communicate with the Garou in accordance with its nature
  • The spirit is not bound, controlled, or required to remain

Mechanical Clarifications

The Rite:

  • Does not force the spirit to appear
  • Does not grant the spirit combat actions or statistics
  • Does not allow the Garou to command or direct the spirit
  • If the spirit refuses the summons, no additional effect occurs and the Gnosis is still spent
  • Hostile or powerful spirits may answer in unexpected ways at the Storyteller's discretion

Limitations

This Rite cannot summon:

  • Major spirits, gods, or unique entities
  • Spirits warded against summoning

The spirit may depart at any time. A given spirit may only be summoned by this Rite once per Caern Turn.

Narrative Use

The Rite of Summoning is commonly used to:

  • Seek information or guidance
  • Request aid through negotiation
  • Open dialogue with spirits tied to a location or event

The Rite establishes contact, not authority.
